Ring-bearers was a title used for those three Hobbits (Bilbo Baggins
column2: Frodo Baggins and Samwise Gamgee) who had at one time borne the One Ring
column3: and aided in its destruction. Because of their status as Ring-bearers
column4: they were granted the passage of the Straight Road
column5: and each eventually went to the Aman to live out their lives.

column1: Though only these three Hobbits are strictly counted as Ring-bearers
column2: in fact the Ring was borne by other hands besides; and over its history of about 4.8 millennia only a very few individuals had ever touched it.

column1: ==List of persons who touched the Ring==
Those who actually wore the Ring
column2: as opposed to picking it up or holding it

column1: * Sauron - He forged the One Ring for himself around  and bore it for approximately 1840 years until his defeat in the Siege of Barad-dûr in .
* Isildur - Against the advice of Elrond and Círdan
column2: he took the Ring for himself. He did not bear it long - two years later
column3: Isildur was ambushed by Orcs and the One Ring was lost in the Anduin on 4 October
column5: where it lay hidden for most of the Third Age.

column1: * Déagol - He discovered the Ring while fishing the Gladden Fields in about . He held it for only a short time before he was murdered by his friend Sméagol
column2: who stole the Ring for himself.

column1: * Gollum - He took the Ring from Déagol
column2: and soon hid with it in the roots of the Misty Mountains. He bore it in the dark for almost five hundred years.

column1: * Bilbo Baggins - He discovered the Ring by accident while imprisoned beneath the Misty Mountains in July
column2: and claimed it from Gollum by defeating him in a Riddle-game. He carried it eastward to Lonely Mountain
column3: and then back westward to the Shire
column4: where he kept it. He bore the Ring for almost exactly sixty years.

column1: * Frodo Baggins - He was given the Ring by Bilbo on the advice of Gandalf. He was the Ring-bearer
column2: who carried the One Ring from the Shire to Orodruin
column3: to the very brink of the Cracks of Doom. Once there
column5: and he named it to himself
column6: but Gollum bit it from his finger and fell into the Fire. Frodo bore the Ring for seventeen years until its destruction.

column1: * Gandalf - He held it for a matter of moments on the morning of 13 April
column3: before throwing it into Frodos fire. This was the moment that the Rings fiery inscription appeared
column4: confirming that it was the One Ring.

column1: * Tom Bombadil - He wore it on his finger for a moment on 27 September
column3: but was unaffected by it. The reason that Tom was immune to the effects of the Ring remains an abiding mystery.

column1: * Samwise Gamgee - He bore the Ring for about two days in March
column2: while Frodo his master was in the clutches of Orcs in the Tower of Cirith Ungol.
